Title: Friday the 13th
Actors: William Bechtel, Miriam Nesbitt, Marie Tener
Plot: Mr. Gayton is given tickets for the theater. He hurries to his suburban home. In his hurry to adorn himself in sartorial habiliments, he forgets the tickets. He rushes back, and when he boards a trolley car he finds that he has no money, and the fuse of the car blows out. However, a passing friend with an auto accommodates them. The tire is punctured. They arrive at the dock, only to see the ferry sail away. Mr. Gayton now suggests that they go to an inn for dinner. They arrive only to find that it is in flames. They encounter many more amusing incidents, and before they are finally inside of their house, Gayton finds that he had left the key inside. As he is climbing through the window he is caught by a cop, who is about to arrest him, and is only saved from humiliation by Mrs. Gayton, who explains things.
